column4: anyone know how i would escape setTimeout('TINY.box.show("session.php?suid=<?php echo $id; ?>",1,200,200,1,0);', <?php echo $timeLeft; ?>); in a sed replace?
are there octal/hex escapes allowed in sed?  I'd go that route.
i dont know what you mean
darn, sed (which uses GNU regexes, right?) doesn't recognize \x00 to \xFF as ASCII escapes. :(   THis is from http://www.regular-expressions.info/refflavors.html
